dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S989 IS: Strengthening Health Disparities Data Collection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Schatz introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To eliminate the prerequisite of direct appropriations relating to collection of health data and to modify standards for measuring sexual orientation and gender identity.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthening Health Disparities Data Collection Act.

section.header: Standards for measuring sexual orientation and gender identity in collection of health data
section.text: Section 3101(a) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300kk(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(C), by inserting sexual orientation, gender identity, before and disability status; and
in paragraph (2)(B), by inserting sexual orientation, gender identity, before and disability status.

section.header: Elimination of prerequisite of direct appropriations for data collection and analysis
section.text: Section 3101 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300kk) is amended—
